natural problem: Find the sum of the quotient and remainder when $6x^3+9x^2-17x+11$ is divided by $2x^2+5x-1$.
natural solution: \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & -6x^2 & -15x &+3 \\ \cline{3-5} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & 0 & x & +8 \\ \end{array} \]The quotient is $3x-3$ and the remainder is $x+8$ so their sum is $\boxed{4x+5}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R S :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 6 * x powr 3 + 9 * x powr 2 - 17 * x + 11"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = 2 * x powr 2 + 5 * x - 1"
and h2 : "P x dvd Q x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x = Q x * R x + S x"
shows  "R x + S x = 4 * x + 5"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the sum of the quotient and remainder when $6x^3+9x^2-17x+11$ is divided by $2x^2+5x-1$. The final Answer is 4x+5
 ### Proof
 \[ \begin{array}{c|cc cc} \multicolumn{2}{r}{3x} & -3 \\ \cline{2-5} 2x^2+5x-1 & 6x^3&+9x^2&-17x&+11 \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{6x^3} & +15x^2 & -3x  \\ \cline{2-4} \multicolumn{2}{r}{0} &  -6x^2 & -14x &+11 \\
 \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & -6x^2 & -15x &+3 \\ \cline{3-5} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & 0 & x & +8 \\ \end{array} \]The quotient is $3x-3$ and the remainder is $x+8$ so their sum is $\boxed{4x+5}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R S :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 6 * x powr 3 + 9 * x powr 2 - 17 * x + 11"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = 2 * x powr 2 + 5 * x - 1"
and h2 : "P x dvd Q x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x = Q x * R x + S x"
shows  "R x + S x = 4 * x + 5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Given the two polynomial functions $P(x) = 6x^3 + 9x^2 - 17x + 11$ and $Q(x) = 2x^2 + 5x - 1$, find two functions $R(x)$ and $S(x)$ such that $P(x) = Q(x) * R(x) + S(x)$ and that $P(x)$ is a divisor of $Q(x)$. The final answer is that $R(x) + S(x) = 4x + 5$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem

assumes h0 : "quot = (6*x^3 + 9*x^2 - 17*x + 11) div (2*x^2 + 5*x - 1)"

 *)

shows  "quot + rem = 4*x + 5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 6 * x powr 3 + 9 * x powr 2 - 17 * x + 11"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = 2 * x powr 2 + 5 * x - 1"
and h2 : "P x dvd Q x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x = Q x * R x + (P x mod Q x)"
shows  "R x + (P x mod Q x) = 4 * x + 5"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the sum of the quotient and remainder when $6x^3+9x^2-17x+11$ is divided by $2x^2+5x-1$. The final Answer is 4x+5
 ### Proof
 \[ \begin{array}{c|cc cc} \multicolumn{2}{r}{3x} & -3 \\ \cline{2-5} 2x^2+5x-1 & 6x^3&+9x^2&-17x&+11 \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{6x^3} & +15x^2 & -3x  \\ \cline{2-4} \multicolumn{2}{r}{0} &  -6x^2 & -14x &+11 \\

 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 6 * x powr 3 + 9 * x powr 2 - 17 * x + 11"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = 2 * x powr 2 + 5 * x - 1"
and h2 : "P x dvd Q x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x = Q x * R x + (P x mod Q x)"
shows  "R x + (P x mod Q x) = 4 * x + 5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem: Given two polynomials $P(x) = 6x^3 + 9x^2 - 17x + 11$ and $Q(x) = 2x^2 + 5x - 1$, find the value of $R(x) + (P(x) \mod Q(x))$ such that $P(x)$ is divisible by $Q(x)$ and $P(x) = Q(x) \cdot R(x) + (P(x) \mod Q(x))$. The final answer is $4x + 5$.
